template.name: 3CX PBX Debian Linux
template.description: 3CX PBX Template (https://www.3cx.com) monitors services are running. Do NOT put checks which are not unique to 3CX in this template.

item.name: 3CX HTTP PBX WebUI
item.description: 5000/tcp for HTTP WebUI. Ideally you would be using HTTPS to connect to the other one for securitry reasons of course.

item.name: 3CX HTTPS PBX WebUI
item.description: This checks the HTTPS WebUI is running on the 5001/tcp port. For checking you can actually browse to it, that would be a web scenario

item.name: 3CX PBX TCP SIP Port
item.description: 5060/TCP is used for SIP connections. VOIP PBXs use this

item.name: 3CX UDP SIP Service
item.description: UDP/5060 is also used by 3CX and PBX servers. So monitor that too

item.name: 3CX UDP Tunnel Service
item.description: UDP/5090 is used by 3CX Tunnel Broker so we need to monitor that

item.name: 3CX UDP IVR Service
item.description: UDP/5483 is used by 3CX IVR so we need to monitor that

item.name: 3CX UDP Queue Manager Service
item.description: UDP/5488 is used by 3CX Queue Manager so we need to monitor that

item.name: 3CX UDP System Services
item.description: UDP/49465 is used by 3CX System Services Monitoring so we can watch them watching us

item.name: Distro Code Name
item.description:
Grab the distribution codename. E.g. jessie, stretch, buster, etc.
Required as not all the parameters in the 50unattended-upgrades file exist in all the distros.

item.name: 3cxcertbot.sh checksum
item.description: Checksum of our scritp. Helps to identify nodes with wrong version installed.

item.name: /etc/logrotate.d/3cxcdrlogs Logrotate definition
item.description: /etc/logrotate.d/3cxcdrlogs needs to exist for 3CX CDR logs to rotate properly.

item.name: telnet Package
item.description: tshark is the telnet client. Eddie suggests installing it on 3CX PBX server for those times when one is trobuleshooting, so this check for it

item.name: tshark Package
item.description: tshark is the command line version of wireshark. Eddie suggests installing it on 3CX PBX server for those times when one is trobuleshooting, so this check for it

item.name: 3cxcertbot.sh script
item.description: 3cxcertbot.sh needs to exist to fully automate Let's Encrypt certificate reneals on 3CX

item.name: 3CX CDR call logs script
item.description: Custom script for sendmail email logs from CDR.

item.name: 3cxpbx Package
item.description: if the PBX server doesn't exist we cannot possibly be a Linux PBX

item.name: /var/lib/3cxpbx/Instance1/Data/Logs/CDRLogs/cdr.log log file
item.description: 3CX PBX CDR log. This is used if the CDR2email functionality is needed. also take note of the global Macro CDRENABLED

item.name: Debian Unattended Upgrades auto-fix dpkg enabled
item.description: 3CX unattended upgrades are a little more conservative. Fold these 3CX specific checks into the 3CX template

item.name: Debian Unattended Upgrades remove unused dependencies enabled
item.description: 3CX unattended upgrades are a little more conservative. Fold these 3CX specific checks into the 3CX template

item.name: Debian Unattended Upgrades Auto-reboot time enabled
item.description: 3CX unattended upgrades are a little more conservative. Fold these 3CX specific checks into the 3CX template

item.name: Debian Unattended Upgrades no Logged in users Automatic Reboot enabled
item.description: 3CX unattended upgrades are a little more conservative. Fold these 3CX specific checks into the 3CX template

item.name: Debian Unattended Upgrades no Automatic Reboot enabled
item.description: 3CX unattended upgrades are a little more conservative. Fold these 3CX specific checks into the 3CX template

item.name: Debian Unattended Upgrades security updates enabled
item.description: 3CX unattended upgrades are a little more conservative. Fold these 3CX specific checks into the 3CX template

item.name: CDR2email cron job
item.description:
3CX CDR2email cron job.
By default, this is not used, unless the Macro ${CDRENABLED} is set to 1. the default globally is to set it to 0 (i.e. not required.

item.name: 3CX Remote Commands Enabled Zabbix Agent
item.description: 3CX unattended upgrades are a little more conservative. Fold these 3CX specific checks into the 3CX template

httptest.name: 3CX HTTPS PBX WebUI Availability
httptest.agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:33.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/33.0

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} auto-fix dpkg not enabled in /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades
Hey! {HOST.NAME} Automatic Reboot not enabled in /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades
Hey! {HOST.NAME} Automatic Reboot time not enabled in /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades

trigger.expression: {3CX PBX Debian Linux:vfs.file.regmatch[/etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades,Unattended\-Upgrade\:\:Automatic\-Reboot\-WithUsers\s+\"true\"\;,UTF8,,].last()}=0 and {3CX PBX Debian Linux:system.run[/usr/bin/lsb_release -c -s].str(jessie)}=0
trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} Automatic Reboot withh logged in users not enabled in /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades
Hey! {HOST.NAME} Debian Security Updates not enabled in /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades
Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no 3cxcertbot.sh installed
trigger.description: /usr/local/bin/.last(0)}=0 doesn't exist then package zabbix-get is not installed and therefore, alert us to this fact.

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no 3cxpbx package installed
trigger.description: If this packages is not installed, the server cannot function as a 3CX PBX

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no telnet package installed
trigger.description: troubleshooting connections with telnet at the suggestion of Eddie from 3CX we install this

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has no tshark package installed
trigger.description: troubleshooting connections with tshark the command line version of wireshark at the suggestion of Eddie from 3CX we install this

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} has the wrong 3cxcertbot.sh version
trigger.description: If the checksum is wrong, then the wrong version is installed.

trigger.name: Hey! {HOST.NAME} Remove-Unused-Dependencies not enabled in /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades
Hey {HOST.NAME} has no EnableRemoteCommands set to enabled
{HOST.NAME} has a pending reboot
{HOST.NAME} has no /etc/logrotate.d/3cxcdrlogs file!
trigger.description: /etc/logrotate.d/3cxcdrlogs has to exist for logs to rotate. If it does not, alert to this fact.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no /usr/local/bin/3cxlogs.sh cron job in /etc/crontab
trigger.description:
01 30 * * * root /usr/local/bin/3cxlogs.sh pbx@example.com logs@example.com
Rememebr: You want this job to run the day *after* you want logs. so my suggestion is to use iether 01:30 or 02:30 each morning as the shell script sends over yesterday's logs.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no /usr/local/bin/3cxlogs.sh script!
trigger.description: If the shell script does not exist, throw an alert.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no 3CX Queue Manager Listener on UDP/5488
trigger.description: if port UDP/5488 is not open then 3CX Queue Manager is not working

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no 3CX Service Manager Listener on UDP/49465
trigger.description: if port UDP/49465 is not open then 3CX cannot self monitor

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no 3CX Tunnel on UDP/5090
trigger.description: if port UDP/5090 is not open then we're not able create a 3CX Tunnel and that's not good

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no cdr.log Please enable CDR in 3CX WebUI > Settings > CDR
trigger.description: /var/lib/3cxpbx/Instance1/Data/Logs/CDRLogs/cdr.log needs to exist, and also the macro {$CDRENABLED} needs to be set to 1 in the *node* macro to override the default.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no HTTPS WebUI on TCP/{$3CXHTTPSWEBUI}
trigger.description: if port 5060/TCP is not open then we're not able to accept SIP so no PBX

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no HTTP WebUI on TCP/{$3CXHTTPWEBUI}
trigger.description: if port 5060/TCP is not open then we're not able to accept SIP so no PBX

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no IVR Service on UDP/49465
trigger.description: if port UDP/5483 is not open then 3CX IVR is not functioning

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no SIP Listener on TCP/5060
trigger.description: if port TCP/5060 is not open then we're not able to accept SIP so no PBX

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has no SIP Listener on UDP/5060
trigger.description: if port UDP/5060 is not open then we're not able to accept SIP so no PBX
